str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Joppa, a coast town of Judea, west-north-west of Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Joppe, a place in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Mid: I summon to myself, send for. From meta and kaleo; to call elsewhere, i.e. Summon.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) To call (name) by a supplementary (additional, alternative) name, (b) mid: To call upon, appeal to, address.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I entertain a stranger, (b) I startle, bewilder. From xenos; to be a host; by implication, be strange.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
A tanner. From bursa; a tanner.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
